page.title: 06Borley
page.content: Population - 103. 1.{Borley Green.} On one side are two bungalows and four council houses. Two roads fork off with old cottages and another pair of council houses and two substantial farmhouses. A Prisoners of War camp is now a market garden. 2. About 1/2km away at the top of the hill is the{church}dominated by the canopied Tudor tomb of Sir Edward Waldegrave, a staunch Roman Catholic who was twice imprisoned in the Tower. People think there is a{ghost}but that was across the road at the Rectory, which was burned to the ground and replaced by a row of five bungalows. 3. Down below, near Borley Hall and {Mill}are two pairs of council houses, the Board School (now village hall) and School House, an old twin cottage, two big bungalows, and market garden. The old{railway}is a public footpath.
